page.title: 10BRAES SHOPPING AND TRANSPORT
page.content: There is no longer a shop in the area, but milk is delivered every other day, twice a week a baker's van comes, and a fishman once. There is a general store 4 miles away at Tomnavoulin and for a nominal fee, goods can be delivered by the Royal Mail. As the school bus is the only public transport, most people have cars and can travel to centres like Elgin, Inverness and Aberdeen. Several weeks supplies are usually bought at once to save on travelling expenses, and also during the winter to be prepared to be cut off for some time by snow-blocked roads. In spring and Autumn, large drapery vans visit the area with household utensiles as well as cloths, sheets, towels etc. Once a fortnight the mobile library calls with a wide selection on offer.
